attributes.comment:
Please let it be known that I am opposed to the proposed increase in fees for the
I600A and fingerprinting. Not only is it disappointing that the fingerprints and
I171H expire so quickly (15 -18 months), requiring all waiting (China) adoptive
parents to re-file, but to have to pay the increased fees is unreasonable. The
USCIS states that adoption is their highest priority, but I assure you that is not felt
in the adoption community. Long waits, high fees, and short shelf-lives are all
valid complaints for those of us in the international adoption community. Please
do not raise your fees!
Marcy Dunaway
a waiting adoptive parent
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Marcy J. Dunaway
